sub_title: Engineering the future of 3D imaging | Avid language and culture enthusiast
summary:
I'm an engineer who enjoys working in multidisciplinary and multicultural environments. I'm passionate about finding new ways to improve the quality of life for others. This sometimes means improving the existing methods and other times finding disruptive ideas in the light of societal needs. I love to see the big picture in my work, while still being in touch with its details. This is why I keep a close eye on the trends in the world of medical devices/imaging. 

I enjoy expressing scientific research and ideas in simplified terms via writing and presentations, in an effort to make science and engineering more relatable for everyone. I believe in the importance of working within multidisciplinary teams, collaborating with various partners for the betterment of research and development of new ideas.

Areas of interest: Medical imaging, medical devices, image guided therapy, radiotherapy

Technical skills: Tomographic image reconstruction algorithms, metal artifact reduction methods in cone beam computed tomography (CBCT), positron emission tomography (PET) design and reconstruction, Matlab, Python

I am on LinkedIn to make new connections, network and build lasting business relations.

projects.title: Academy of Finland Key Project 2016-2018: High- and low-frequency inverse imaging with signal sparsity: biomedical and astro/geophysical applications
projects.description: The primary goal of this project is to develop and implement computational imaging methods for applications involving low- and highfrequency signals and sparsity of signal transmitters or receivers. A need to limit the coverage of a signal can follow from several factors, such as the target's physical properties, risks, costs, and signal diffusion. The present focus is, in particular, on biomedical and astro/geophysical applications.

contributors.headline: Engineering the future of 3D imaging | Avid language and culture enthusiast
Professor of Applied Mathematics at Tampere University

projects.title: Avantomography
projects.description: AvanTomography project is a compact, module for Positron Emission Tomography. Thanks to the axial crystal orientation, AvanTomography can achieve a uniform spatial resolution and eliminate the parallax error by detecting the 3D coordinates of the positron annihilation (without the uncertainty on depth of interaction). The compact design of the module enables various configurations, plate or full ring, can be obtained by using multiple modules, allowing the screening of different regions of the human body. The compact size allows also low cost of production.

Senior Imaging Engineer at Xiaomi Technology

profile_positions.description:
As a member of the Image Quality team in IGT-Systems, my responsibilities include
• Looking for opportunities for improvements based on customer feedback and trends in imaging
• Gathering feedback from clinicians about our new and existing procedures
• Supporting customer complaint investigations
• Participating in risk assessment of new algorithms
• Validation and verification of new procedures

Technical expertise: CBCT physics, image quality, artifacts and removal algorithms, image guided therapy systems, validation of 3D algorithms and procedures, Python.
profile_positions.title: Image Quality Specialist

profile_positions.description:
As a member of the Imaging Core Group, my responsibilities included
• System characterization / phenomenological description of effects in X-ray imaging and CBCT reconstruction,
• Contributing to shape innovations such as new correction methods and artifact suppression technologies for reducing patient dose while improving image quality.

I have also been heavily involved in the application process of a 1 year commercialization funding that was approved by the Austrian and European funding agencies for development of diagnostic imaging methods.

Technical expertise: CBCT physics, image quality, artifacts and removal algorithms, calibration and verification methods, Matlab.
profile_positions.title: Computed Tomography Imaging Expert

profile_positions.description:
During my work, I focused on the processing of tomographic data from computed tomography (CT) and positron emission tomography (PET) as well as design of nuclear medicine instrumentation like PET.

•	Conducted interviews with industry partners and universities to determine the industry needs for reconstruction algorithms. 
•	Collaborated with industry and university partners.
•	Developed 3 reconstruction methods for metal artifact reduction with dental and cone-beam CT data while obtaining a thorough understanding of the working principles and challenges of CT.
•	Proposed a reconstruction method for dose delivery verification in radiation therapy with PET (in-beam PET), which could accommodate high noise levels and limited angular coverage.
•	Designed and conducted simulations to test the performance of the proposed reconstruction methods.
•	Supervised 2 master's thesis students in their thesis work planning and completion.

Technical expertise: medical image reconstruction, image processing, breast cancer screening, nuclear medicine, PET design, tomographic imaging, Monte Carlo simulations in Gate, Matlab.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Topic: Design and construction of a novel PET demonstrator for breast cancer screening

•	Acquired market knowledge on PET scanners specialized on breast cancer screening.
•	Managed a multinational and interdisciplinary research team of 8 people during the project.
•	Responsible for the management of the budget, resource allocation and logistics.
•	Worked with researchers in the design, assembly, measurement and commercialization processes.
•	Presented the project in 6 national and international symposiums/conferences.
•	Submitted a patent application.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Topic: Metal artifact reduction in dental CT images

•	Developed a numerical 3D jaw phantom in Matlab for investigating the effects of jaw tilting on dental CT data.
•	Proposed a new segmentation method for metal artifact reduction in dental CT .
•	Conducted simulations with simulated and real data to test the efficiency of the proposed methods.

Technical expertise: Matlab, image segmentation, image reconstruction, metal artifact reduction, working with experimental CT data. 

Thesis available: https://dspace.cc.tut.fi/dpub/handle/123456789/21565
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Supervised graduate and undergraduate Biomedical Engineering students in design and construction of an electrocardiographic (ECG) amplifier circuit
•	Mentored students in designs and construction of the PCBs.

Technical expertise: PCB design, Altium Designer 6, Proteus Design Suite, component selection, etching, assembly and testing of circuit boards, ECG measurements.
profile_positions.title: Teaching assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Analyzed the requirements for an EEG impedance analysis system.
•	Designed an electrode bioimpedance analysis system for a 6-channel wireless EEG.

Technical expertise: Altium designer 6, troubleshooting, PCB design, hardware design, component selection.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Contributed to the maintenance of medical devices such as computed tomography, roentgen and mammography at different hospitals in Istanbul
•	Assisted the Technical Group Manager by planning maintenance schedules and assignments
profile_positions.title: Intern
